isis.stitle: TSI 96-12-13 - Replace 12 Point Valve Lever Mounting Bolts with New Standard Hex Head Flanged Mounting Bolts

subjectgroup.subject: Replace 12 Point Valve Lever Mounting Bolts with New Standard Hex Head Flanged Mounting Bolts

geninfo.para: A standard hex head flanged bolt had been implemented in production, replacing the 12 point valve lever mounting bolt. Use the following steps when tightening the new mounting bolts.

svcproc.title: Valve Lever Mounting Bolt Tightening Procedure

important.para: A new procedure is being used to tighten the valve lever mounting bolts. This procedure replaces the procedure found in service manual, EGES 120.

step1.para: Coat the valve lever, valve lever posts and mounting bolts with clean engine oil.

important.para: Pushrods must be in place when valve lever assemblies are installed.

step1.para: Position pistons off Top Dead Center (TDC). Rotate the crankshaft until vibration damper notch is the vertical position. This positions all pistons below TDC, so valves do not contact pistons when tightening valve lever assemblies (Figure 1).

note.para: Observe position of keyway on vibration damper, as shown in Figure 1, when pistons are positioned below TDC.

step1.para: Tighten each pair of valve lever mounting bolts down evenly, to the following torque value: 24 N·m (18 ft·lbf) (Figure 2).
